page.title: 03HARROLD GREEN
page.content: Harrold Green. Harrold Green is a small area of grass in the centre of Harrold with three buildings situated on it and many beautiful old buildings surrounding it. The first old building is the Market House, or Butter Market. It was built by labourers employed by the Duke of Kent between l7O2 and 1764. It was used to sell cattle, butter and other agricultural material. Eight wooden pillars support an octagonal tiled roof. There is an octagonal bell housing on top of the roof, with a weather vane on top of that. The second old building is the Cage or Lock-Up.This was built in 1824 and it is a circular stone building four square feet in area. The only window is very small and is at least six feet
